intro: Echites cobanensis, commonly known as the Coban spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
